Bated the 9th December 1933. h T mperiai 'irw^ys received following from Shaibuh on 8th December addressed Bahrain, Shargah Gwadur repeated Karachi begins ' reference S.7I5 dated 1st December Dutch Civil Aircraft Post JAGEA call sign PHOST flight to Singapore commences xiKK December 9th Aircraft due over Baghdad about 0700 C.M.T. IOth proceeding Shaibah. ’’Ends. I have no information about this flight. In even of landing at Bahrain or Shargah is she to be permitted to proceed. Politicil.Telegram:- X/27. From:- Resident Bushire* To:- Political Banrain. No:- 1115. Latea:- 10th Lecember 1933. IMMEDIATE. Your telegram 1499. 1. I have no previous information of this flight. 2. Situation is that Shaikh of Bahrain and Sultan of Muscat have given their permission for Lutch K.L.M aircraft to fly over and land in their territories landing on Trucial Coast was excluded for present by His Majesty f s Covernment. 3. If machine is K.L.M on tnis occasion she can land Sharjah but I will take up matter with Kis Majesty’s Government. If privately owned machine tnere (?she?) should be detained. ::Resiaent::/v CHIT WESSAGE. 4 (D s.ru ^ AIRWAYS SHARJAH AW/ 10 / 12 . Shaibah telegram December 8th. If Dutch Civil Aircraft lands she may be permitted to proceed if she belongs to K.L.M.Company. If she is privately owned machine she should be detained pending further instructions. Bahrain. The 10th December 1933. 71 B. M’s: Political Agent Bahrain, (Persian Quit.)o 1 S no'f CHIT lf3SS\GS < AIRWAYS SHARJAH AW/ 13/12. Bahrain. BEGINS. Following f*om the Political Agent My telegram 1506. Have you any news of Dutch aeroplane? POLITICAL 1520

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 21/28 Correspondence regarding flight of Dutch Civil Aircraft Post "JAGEA"'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 12; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 2-10; these numbers are written in blue crayon, and are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence relating to the flight to Singapore of the Dutch Civil Aircraft Post 'Jagea'. The correspondence is between:Imperial Airways Ltd, both in Shaibah and Sharjah;Trenchard Craven William Fowle, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bushire;Percy Gordon Loch, Political Agent at Bahrain.The flight was permitted and expected to land at Sharjah and the correspondence reflects this. There is no evidence within the file to suggest it did so.There are internal office notes on folio 11.
